Story.title: Edward: His Dark Thingamajigs
Story.Description: Edward used to be in the popular crowd, before he fell in with the Goths. Though his English teachers disapprove, Edward's poetry now feels like a true expression of his soul, a reflection of 'the blackness that endarkles the heart' (B minus). But with prom week at hand, Edward's self-reflection has deepened. Will he stay on the path of darkness, or go towards the light? And who will he take with him?

GoalDescription.words: Darkness engulfs Edward's fragile mortal heart, commanding him to totally piss everyone off.

taskNaturalLanguage.words: Make sure Edward ###EDWARD### is not dating anyone ###NOT DATING###

TidBit.text: Word in the halls is that Edward is burning bridges faster than a fire under a bridge.
Edward is starting to hear stronger, twisting whispers from the Darkness.
Edward is certainly picking up enemies. What's up with th
Everyone else just can't quite figure out what's going on with Edward. What is he up to?
Edward has been posting weird things to SkimmdIt. Something about a ritual...?

GoalDescription.words: Edward didn't always used to be so enamoured with the shadows... maybe it's not too late to head towards the light.

taskNaturalLanguage.words: Get Edward ###EDWARD### to be nice once

TidBit.text: Suddenly, everyone is talking about Edward. What's gotten into that dark and handsome stranger?
Random freshmen and sophomores have started wearing black. Just because he can't spell 'zeitgeist' doesn't mean Edward isn't setting some trends...
Maybe magic *is* real... Edward certainly seems to be enchanting everyone.
For the first time in years, Edward is becoming popular again. Weird!
The name on everyone's lips this morning is 'Edward.' Maybe the dark can coexist with the limelight.

GoalDescription.words: Why choose between being Goth and being popular? Edward is determined to make them one and the same.

taskNaturalLanguage.words: Get at least five people to think that Edward ###EDWARD### is totally cool ###COOL UP###
Make sure fellow goth Mave ###MAVE### has at least five friends ###FRIENDS###
Destroy Buzz ###BUZZ### by getting him to have less than 2 friends ###NOT FRIENDS###
Sabotage Monica ###MONICA### by making her have less than 2 friends ###NOT FRIENDS###

Instantiation.name: Ending A: Falling to the Dark Arts

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: BEHOLD, HUMANS. TREMBLE AND BEWARE! FOR DARKNESS HAS COME TO YOUR REALM!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I think he's finally lost it.

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Wow, this ought to be good. Hey, everyone! Edward thinks he's in Harry Potter or something!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I, Edward THE BANEFUL, have finally unlocked my *true* potential!
While all you petty fools were ignoring me and hating me, I found solace in much more beautiful things!
Powerfully beautiful things, powers your feeble minds wouldn't even be able to comprehend!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Try us.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: SILENCE! My ritual is almost complete. It required only the hate of my peers, and the breath of a virgin.
Behold! It begins. Watch as I open the gateway to the twisted realms, where all your souls will be consumed!
It's coming! JUST YOU WAIT!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I'm outta here.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: FEAR ME, IMBECILES! I... I'm... *sigh*... Going home.

Ending.name: Back in the Swing of Things

Instantiation.name: Ending B: Darkness is *IN* Right Now

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Edward! Edward! Hey, how are you?

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Oh, Edward! So glad you could make it out tonight. You look FABULOUS!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Why thank you, fair creature. Most feliticinous of you!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I don't know what that means, but thank you!

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Hey, Edward. How'd you suddenly become the coolest kid in school, anyway? Most people think Goths are dorks.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Well %o%, I'll tell you something. It's not about how you dress. Although, that helps.
A lot.
But what really matters is looking inside your heart. And being true to what you find in there.
Which is mostly blood, interestingly.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: That's so deep, Edward. You should totally be like a poet or something!

LineOfDialogue.otherLine: Yeah! I would totally click on lots of ads on your poetry blog.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Yes... All according to plan...

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Well, Edward, I don't know how you did it. But in one week, you managed to totally redefine what popular means at this school.
It's not right. Oswald got slammed into a locker by some freshman wearing a cape. What have you done, man?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Well, Nicholas, I guess it just goes to show. What comes up, must go down.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: That's not even how that phrase goes, you idiot.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Face it, Nicholas. You were only ever cool because you tricked everyone into thinking there was a thing called cool and you were it.
Now Goths are cool. But maybe next year when Mave and I are gone, it might be someone else. Maybe even the emos.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Saints preserve us.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: The point is, nobody has a monopoly on cool.
Because if they did, everyone would have to pay them some ridiculous amount of money every time they landed on it! At least if they built any hotels there.
What were we talking about again?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: The hell if I know.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Oh yeah! The POINT point is, figure out who you really are and be true to yourself, because popularity is fleeting.
Like cobwebs in candlelight.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: You have *got* to be kidding me.
Oh, Edward. The crowd seems to have temporarily pushed us together. How awkward.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: We could just pretend not to know each other.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I've been doing that all year, it's getting old.
What happened to you, Edward? You used to be cool. Not all weird.
What is that *thing* you're wearing, anyway?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: It doesn't matter. Nothing matters. I thought this week would be different than all the others.
But it's just as terrible as usual.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I'm almost sad.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I just don't know who I am any more, %r%. I wasn't happy as a popular kid, and I'm not happy as a Goth.
Where do you find happiness?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I don't know, Edward. I don't know.
But this is a pretty good song. Maybe you could dance to it. You know, just a little.
It is a dance, after all.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Thanks, %r%. Hey, this is almost fun.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: OK, so I'm going to go over here now, because I don't want anyone to see you dancing with me. See ya!

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %gender(r,He,She)%'s right. It is a dance. After all.
